group_1.textRight: My home is in the Toki Village, so I will be taking@a bus from here.

group_1.textLeft: Because my home is in the Yukuni Hot Springs@Village, I'll be taking a different bus from Miura's.

group_1.textRight: My house is the opposite way, on the port side.@Everyone's different, huh?[chara:103501:lipSynch_0][wait:0.8][chara:103501:cheek_0][chara:103501:face_mtn_ex_011.exp3.json][chara:103501:lipSynch_1] *Giggle*♪
I don't think I've ever seen such a natural@smile as this before,
even before I'd learned the destiny of Magical@Girls later down the line.
Sasha-dono, your smile is very lovely.

group_1.textLeft: [chara:103501:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]Woah, where did that come from?@How embarrassing...

group_1.textRight: I realized the magnitude of the shadow that@obscured your smile.

group_1.narration: "So, today I would like to introduce@a celebrity from Yukuni City, a street performer@popular among the local young people:@Urara Yume."

group_1.textRight: [chara:103401:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]―?!
That girl on the screen there, isn't she the one@they rescued the other day...?

group_1.textLeft: She who was urged by Kyubey to sign a contract@and also witnessed the Witch transformations...

group_1.textRight: Looks like she was Urara Yume, after all.
She does street performances, which I've watched@before.
Many kids might know her from her appearances@on local TV.
With all the time I've spent in the mountains,@I've never really gotten acquainted with the area...

group_1.textLeft: As I recall, it was your younger siblings who got@you started in street art, wasn't it?

group_1.textRight: That's right.
My family was poor, so it was hard even just@to have enough food to eat every day.
At least we had a farm, so we were okay to a point.
But we didn't have any toys, y'know, so my siblings@were starved for entertainment.

group_1.textLeft: Is that when you first encountered street art?

group_1.textRight: Yeah, I saw a street performance and thought,@"This is what I can do."
So I started practicing balancing,@throwing with a box,
practicing with the diabolo I made myself.
And all my younger siblings began to enjoy it!

group_1.textLeft: And now it's become your job.

group_1.textRight: Even I'm surprised at myself.

group_1.textLeft: Oh, yes, she's been on some special episodes@like this one,
and that's what made people suddenly start@talking about her.

group_1.textRight: That's true, seeing a child younger than me@working so hard
makes me feel like cheering her on.

group_1.textLeft: I know this isn't the best way to put it,
but there might be something like a sympathy@vote involved, too~♪

group_1.narration: "For real, right now I'm just grateful to have@workmates and fans willing to accept my past, see."

group_1.textRight: What's with that mysterious expression...@Is something the matter...?
Wh-what's this suddenly?!

group_1.textLeft: A tight hug out of nowhere is confusing, you@know!

group_1.textCenter: All of a sudden, I grasped the true meaning of@the desolation I was carrying...
What I felt about being ensnared was neither fear,@nor emptiness, nor anger,
but simply a profound sense of loneliness.
It's because, like Urara Yume, I deeply yearn for acceptance from others.
In a situation where no one knows about my@circumstances and no one will recognize me,

group_1.textRight: It's just the three of us all alone, sharing a secret...

group_1.textCenter: Even within the confined world of Magical Girls...
